DESIGN AND ANALYSIS OF ALGORITHMS

Course Code:- 24ECSC205

Credits:- 4

Course Instructor:- Mallikarjun Akki

Course Introduction

What is the course about?

The Design and Analysis of Algorithms course helps us understand how to design and evaluate algorithms to tackle problems effectively. We explore key concepts like time and space complexity, which help us measure an algorithm's efficiency. The course also emphasizes how to select the right algorithm for specific scenarios and improve existing ones for better performance.

Studied Data Structures and Algorithms

Data Structures:

Arrays

Linked Lists

Stacks

Queues

Heap

Hash

Trees:

BST (Binary Search Tree)

2-3 Tree

AVL Trees

Red-Black Trees

Segment Trees

Trie

Graphs:

Graph Representations

Traversal Techniques (BFS, DFS)

Sorting Techniques:

Quick Sort

Merge Sort

Heap Sort

Selection Sort

Bubble Sort

Insertion Sort

Graph Algorithms:

Dijkstra's Shortest Path

Floyd's Algorithm

Kruskal's Algorithm

Warshall's Algorithm

Prim's Minimum Spanning Tree

Bellman-Ford Algorithm

String Search Algorithms:

Brute Force String Search

Boyer-Moore

KMP String Matching

Rabin-Karp
